graphanalysis.scheduling

Class ListScheduling

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphanalysis.scheduling.ListScheduling

  • public class ListScheduling
extends java.lang.Object
    Perform List scheduling algorithm.
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> generateSchedule(int numProcessors)
        Generate a schedule using list scheduling for fixed number of processors
        Parameters:
        numProcessors - number of processors
        Returns:
        tasks with their start times

      • getTimeIncrement

        private int getTimeIncrement(int numProcessors,
                   int forProcessor)
        Function to increment the time of the processor in case there is no ready actor.
        Parameters:
        numProcessors - total number of processors
        forProcessor - the processor for which the time should be incremented
        Returns:
        minimum time increment for a processor

      • calculateBuffer

        private int calculateBuffer(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> model)
        Calculate the buffer size for the schedule
        Parameters:
        model - schedule containing tasks and their start times
        Returns:
        total buffer size

      • generateModel

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> generateModel()
        Generate a model from the schedule.
        Returns:
        Model containing start times, processor allocations for all the tasks

      • selectReadyActor

        private Actor selectReadyActor()
        This function selects actor from the ready list. We can customize this function to do different variants in the list scheduling algorithm.
        Returns:
        Selected ready actor

      • computeRandomStrategy

        private void computeRandomStrategy()

      • compareByStrategy

        private int compareByStrategy(ListScheduling.Strategy strategy,
                    Actor actor1,
                    Actor actor2)
        This functions supports the comparator to select an actor between multiple ready actors. ============================================================
        Smallest one has higher priority

        < 0 means actor1 < actor2
        > 0 means actor1 > actor2
        = 0 means actor1 is not comparable to actor2
        ============================================================
        Parameters:
        strategy - strategy to compare the actors
        actor1 - an actor
        actor2 - other actor
        Returns:
        Which actor should be selected according to the strategy

      • getMinStartTime

        private int getMinStartTime(Actor readyActor)
        Depending on when the predecessors end, calculate the start time for the actor.
        Parameters:
        readyActor - ready actor selected
        Returns:
        minimum start time available on the processors

      • calculateReadyActors

        private void calculateReadyActors(int time)
        Calculate ready actors
        Parameters:
        time - current time

      • selectProcWithMinTime

        private int selectProcWithMinTime(int[] processorTime)
        Find processor available with minimum start time
        Parameters:
        processorTime - array with processor times
        Returns:
        processor index with minimum start time
